result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M. Arentz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $150 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact whatsoever with the Trading Post Bar & Grill in Mount Morris.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa M. Arentz

defendant.name: Arentz, Lisa M.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:35 p.m. Defendant Lisa M. Arentz in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by DE. Court orders: 45 days WC Jail - Huber, GT, 1 day CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, NC w/ the Trading Post, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.   Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 6 months, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference on July 11, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Case called @ 2:21 p.m. Defendant Lisa M. Arentz in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting another date as he was recently appointed and has not had an opportunity to review the matter with his client.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:16 PM: Defendant Lisa M. Arentz in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - currently employed PT hours.  Upon suggestion, Def requests to speak with the State w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of counsel for the purposes of a PTC discussion to take place.  NGP entered by Court.   PTC and P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
